page.title: 02AGRICULTURE
page.content: The block of land under survey is dominated by small dairy farms. They occupy from 50 to 100 acres in size and tend to be family farms. The valley floors are improved pasture which is cut in the summer for silage,while the meadows are used for grazing. Other crops grown are maize and wheat for fodder.These are often grown in rotation on the ley grass. The hill slopes and especially the encarpments support sheep grazing. Apart from this some small holders keep pigs and most farms have their own orchards. An important occupation in parts of the upper valley are stables. Horses and donkeys are kept for riding.
